bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: gawk does not include mpfr support. For example: bash$ gawk -M 'BEGIN {printf "%.6f\n", exp(37)}' gawk: warning: -M ignored: MPFR/GMP support not compiled in 11719142372802612.000000
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): gawk-4.1.3-3.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: Run "gawk -M <blah>"
Steps to Reproduce: 1. gawk -M 'BEGIN {printf "%.6f\n", exp(37)}' 2. 3.
Actual results: gawk: warning: -M ignored: MPFR/GMP support not compiled in 11719142372802612.000000
Expected results: 11719142372802611.308594
Additional info: This could easily be fixed by adding "BuildRequires: mpfr-devel" to the spec file. The only question is whether it is preferable to have a minimal gawk that does not depend on gmp and mpfr.

Note: Ubuntu 16.04 includes mpfr support in their build:
$ /usr/bin/gawk --version GNU Awk 4.1.3, API: 1.1 (GNU MPFR 3.1.4, GNU MP 6.1.0) Copyright (C) 1989, 1991-2015 Free Software Foundation.
Fix has been commited to dist-git: http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/gawk.git/commit/gawk.spec?id=08bec36937d
gawk-4.1.3-8.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-30fc11cd13
gawk-4.1.3-8.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-e767636296

gawk-4.1.3-8.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates.
